class_a_01_ecology_01:
Hello, hello. My name’s Jacq, and I’ll be your
Pokémon biology teacher.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_02:
In my class, we’ll all learn about the various
quirks of our beloved Pokémon together![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_03:
I hope you all come to love Pokémon even more
from the things you learn here.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_04:
In today’s class, I’ll teach you a great way to
get to know Pokémon in more depth.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_05:
If you’d like to become better friends with your
Pokémon...[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_06:
you can let them come out of their Poké Ball
and walk along with you! Sounds great, huh?[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_07:
You can use the [VAR COLOR(0006)]ZR Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to throw a Poké Ball
and let out the Pokémon inside.\c
Nothing cuter than watching your Pokémon run
around underfoot, if you ask me.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_08:
Once you let your Pokémon out, try speaking to
them—they’re sure to respond in some way.\r
It’s a great way to get to know them better![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_09:
However! Letting your Pokémon out of its ball
isn’t such a great idea in some locations.\c
Can anyone tell me where it is that you shouldn’t
have your Pokémon walk along with you?[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_answer_01:
It’s certainly true that some Pokémon aren’t fond
of water, but we do have floating platforms they\r
can use, so being near water isn’t an issue.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_answer_02:
[VAR BD06(0000)]That’s right! Great job, [VAR TRNAME(0000)].
I see\r
you\r
did\r
your\r
homework.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_answer_03:
Pokémon love tall grass! I can’t see them having
any problem walking with you there.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_10:
The correct answer is that we should not walk
with our Pokémon indoors. How about that![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_11:
Some Pokémon might damage walls, desks, and
other things walking around inside buildings, so\r
it’s not allowed regardless of the species.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_12:
Therefore, please only let your Pokémon out of
their Poké Balls while outdoors. OK, everyone?\c
I think I see them out and about in classrooms
from time to time, but still...[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_13:
Anyway, you may become even closer friends
with your Pokémon pals by walking together![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_14:
Oh! I almost forgot—keep in mind that you can
only walk together with your lead Pokémon.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_15:
Remember—use the [VAR COLOR(0006)]ZR Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to throw a ball
and let out the Pokémon inside.\c
You’ll also want to remember that throwing a
ball at a wild Pokémon will start a battle![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_01_ecology_16:
It looks like that’s all the time we have for today.
See you all next class![VAR 0114(002A)]
